question: I was watching that.
answer: If I hear one more Beach Boys song, I'll shoot myself. I said, if we were having sex once in a while, you wouldn't need to ride that fucking bike every morning.

question: Be right with you... Have you gotten any sleep lately?
answer: Shop's gonna tow the car in -- goddamn ignition's trashed.

question: Take mine. I'll ride in with Diane.
answer: You ask me, those suckers are a lost cause.

question: It's not for you.
answer: You mean it's not for you.

question: I don't chase car thieves in my underwear. C'mon, you'd die of boredom if we ever sold this house and moved.
answer: I'd die of shock, from finding anyone dumb enough to buy the place. Even for what it's worth now.

question: Lots of people bought at the top of the market...
answer: That sure cheers me right up.

question: I don't know why we even talk about it. The city's not the problem. So we move. It wouldn't matter. What's that saying I hope you're current on your tetanus booster. Was it worth it?
answer: One cut... two assholes in the hospital... Yep. Well, another day of baby-sitting my favorite bunch of people...

question: Ask for a transfer.
answer: They're not gonna transfer me. You know damn well why I was bumped down to guard duty... My outstanding people skills. I hate this fuckin' town.

question: Not if you made it. Why don't you get Sabatini to brew the java? She's the alleged chick.
answer: Blow me.

question: Where's Carson?
answer: On his way. Some creeps tried to rip off his Mustang last night. They cut the ragtop.

question: Motherfuckers... Latest and greatest. Wireless network link-ups.
answer: Whoa, slow down, I'm gonna pee.

question: Carson? Walther. Who told the Ambassador?
answer: His Security Chief. There was a civilian with them -- fifteen-year-old girl from across the street. We're trying to reach the parents.

question: Goddamn it... Look, Mrs. Han was the North Korean Premier's niece! We're hearing rumors they're gonna make a major issue out of what happened here...
answer: I'm not so sure what happened here. Something smells. Asshole was acting like he wanted us to spot him...

question: What the hell are you talking about?
answer: Mr. Walther?

question: Ambassador Han... my deepest --
answer: -- I have no wish for condolences. Just answers.

question: As soon as we have any to give...
answer: Yoon..?!

question: ...You're gonna just pay up, count on his good nature to return the family?!
answer: It's the President's intention to keep this quiet, move forward with the Summit, and work with the North Koreans. Jesus, you've already embarrassed the shit out of us over the phone surveillance --

question: -- They know their phones are tapped! They tap our fucking phones!
answer: That's not the point! The point is not acknowledging it! We got an international incident brewing, with a country we were practically at war with last year! Our best Negotiator is gonna run point. If you got a problem, you can take the goddamn rest of the day off.

question: This Consulate is my responsibility.
answer: Not any more. That's the Negotiator. You do the briefing.

question: ...Our worst enemy'll be the city. There are events gearing up all around town, and a dozen world leaders arriving. Add the Friday rush hour and usual L.A. bad behavior and it'll be a nightmare out there by 3 PM. It all works to the advantage of the kidnapper, hinders our pursuit efforts... You don't agree?
answer: I'm wondering whether to believe him when he says he's strictly motivated by money.

question: You see one word of Peoples'- Liberation, Holy-Jihad, Revolutionary whatever-it-is-we're-pissed-off-about- this-week bullshit in this entire letter?
answer: I still want to check the MO against known politicals, terrorists --

question: -- Already doing it. We're coordinating with the Secret Service, the NSA and the CIA.
answer: Have someone talk to the LAPD, give them a cover story for the media about the crash on La Cienega.

question: He'll expect a homing device --
answer: -- I expect him to expect it. He'll check the cash with an RF detector... Meaning he'll find this one. This only has a quarter-mile range, but on a frequency too low to detect. And I doubt the asshole will have an X-ray machine or a metal detector.

question: Why must you always refer generically to criminals as "assholes?"
answer: Gosh, you're right. It could undermine their self-esteem and spoil their chances for rehabilitation.

question: Do it.
answer: Given his behavior, this orange residue... I'd say Desoxyn, 25 mg. Amphetamines.

question: Any significance?
answer: It's consistent with the lone wolf scenario

question: Get the Bureau on it.
answer: Forget it. It's a waste of manpower.

question: Look, goddammit, you start skipping no-chance-in-hell leads, we can all quit and go to the beach right now. He grabbed the family at 8:30. The last certain visual we had was just before his van went into the alley on La Cienega at 8:42. He called the Consulate at 9:30.
answer: That gives him about fifty minutes to get to his location, move and secure the hostages, and activate his time bomb.

question: He probably waited a while to pad the time -- he wanted us know the family was still alive... ...So these crazy bastards wouldn't throw a premature shit hemorrhage, but he didn't want to call too soon, either. I say they're within 15 to 20 minutes, via surface streets, of where we last saw them.
answer: The most densely-populated part of the L.A. basin. This narrows it down to about 200,000 dwellings. He was traveling west --

question: -- Bet he doubled back.
answer: C'mon, that's total conjecture --

question: Looks like the wheel of a car.
answer: We talked about these billboards, when we were car shopping! Four- door... they make a wagon, too. Something Japanese... God, what was it? Toyota... Mazda... Honda... You thought it had no character.

question: I thought that about all of them. C'mon, think, dammit!!
answer: You think!! You were there, too!

question: Get his Driver's License number; Social; bank accounts; charge cards; club memberships... find out what movies he rented. Get whoever's closest to the Auto Shop to get in there, interview everybody.
answer: This sure was a ballsy move for a car-alarm installer.

question: Hey, he watched the news... Everyone knows the U.S. will do anything to avoid trouble with a mad-dog country.
answer: Ambassador --

question: -- Quit apologizing for me!
answer: Quit giving me reasons to!

question: Hey, you expect to use my station's facilities and not even tell us --
answer: Sorry...

question: What the fuck are you, the Barbie Corporate Ass-Lick model?
answer: Guess what, Sister... you're about to spend the next five years in a penitentiary for interfering with a federal investigation.

question: Hurry it the hell up. I should've known she'd come up.
answer: Pete --

question: -- "Should've." Shit, there's a familiar word. That day... I was there soon enough. We should've rushed 'em, before they could finish setting up...
answer: The Bureau never would've let you. They want it by the book

question: Twelve bodies -- only the hostages.
answer: You were a greenhorn. It wasn't your decision. You can't keep living as such a raw nerve, never sleeping --

question: One of yours? What the hell do you need heat- seeking rockets for in L.A.?
answer: There could be another riot...

question: And they call me Mr. Overkill. Dave, what do you know about...
answer: Strela-2...

question: That Kraut-mobile have any weaknesses you'd like to tell me about?
answer: I don't think so -- they said it was solid as a rock.

question: No shit...
answer: I can't believe I'm still alive...

question: They follow the 110 north. Ahead, Carson sees the Mercedes cutting across lanes.
answer: Got 'im -- looks like he's headed for the 101.

question: Carson has the Pilot hover just above and behind the Mercedes. It comes to a stop and the sunroof opens up.
answer: Pull hard to the left, on my signal...

question: Carson tosses the lit flare, hard, away from the helicopter.
answer: Now!

question: The News Pilot looks over at Carson.
answer: Miranda and the L.A. Cop, both holding small tear gas pistols, split up. Crouching behind the cars on the freeway, they sneak up on the stopped Mercedes.

question: Carson takes another flare out of the canvas bag. He breaks the top off... and it doesn't ignite.
answer: Miranda is climbing the metal stairs leading to a graffiti- covered freeway sign.

question: Carson fumbles to pull another flare out of the canvas bag.
answer: Avoiding coils of razor-sharp concertina wire around the sign, Miranda FIRES a tear gas canister at the Mercedes' sunroof.

question: Carson gets the new flare lit and throws it away from the copter just as Colonel Lee FIRES another rocket.
answer: Colonel Lee spots Miranda, up on the freeway sign, loading another tear gas canister. He STRAFES the sign.
